intro: Oxytropis nanda-devi, commonly known as the Nanda Devi oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas, particularly in India and Nepal. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale yellow to reddish-purple. Its leaves are typically pinnate, with several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis nanda-devi is adapted to high-altitude environments, exhibiting features such as hairy foliage to reduce water loss and withstand cold temperatures.
